intro: Hieracium laevigans, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium laevigans is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
